data: Sir Seitz Siebenburg | Boemund Altrosen | Cordula

One person only besides Sir Seitz Siebenburg had not been deceived—the young knight Boemund Altrosen, whose love for Cordula was genuine, and who, by its unerring instinct, felt that she had invented her tale and for a purpose which did honour to her kindness of heart.

One person only besides Sir Seitz Siebenburg had not been deceived--the young knight Boemund Altrosen, whose love for Cordula was genuine, and who, by its unerring instinct, felt that she had invented her tale and for a purpose which did honour to her kindness of heart.
In the Fire of the Forge: A Romance of Old Nuremberg — Volume 03
Ebers, Georg, 1837-1898; Safford, Mary J. (Mary Joanna), 1842-1916 [Translator]
